Hi Sarah,

I hope you’re doing well. I wanted to share a brief update on the intervention strategies our team has been refining over the past quarter.

1. Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT) Enhancements
   • We have expanded our CBT modules to place a stronger emphasis on building resilience and identifying healthy coping mechanisms.
   • Early outcome tracking indicates noticeable reductions in reported cravings and improved self-management skills across participants.

2. Motivational Interviewing Integration
   • Motivational interviewing has been integrated earlier in the intake process to strengthen client engagement from the outset.
   • Clients report feeling more empowered to set and pursue their own recovery goals, which has correlated with higher program retention.

3. Structured Group Therapy Sessions
   • We transitioned to smaller, theme-focused groups (e.g., stress management, relapse prevention) to foster peer support tailored to specific needs.
   • Preliminary data shows increased participation and a positive shift in group cohesion metrics.

4. Measured Outcomes
   • Across all programs, we’ve observed an overall improvement in key recovery indicators compared with the previous quarter.
   • We continue to gather aggregate data to refine these approaches and will share a more detailed analysis once the dataset is finalized.

Next Steps
   • We are developing facilitator guides to ensure consistent delivery and plan to roll out training sessions in the coming month.
   • I would be happy to discuss how these updates might align with Beacon of Hope’s initiatives.

Please let me know if you’d like any additional information or to set up a time to discuss.

Best regards,
John
Alcohol & Drug Abuse Assistance Coordinator
